articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Combined Unit of KPA Air Force
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Combined Unit of KPA Air Force

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il guided an exercise of the combined unit of the Air Force of the KPA honored with the title of O Jung Hup-led Seventh Regiment. 
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, KPA Vice Marshal Ri Yong Ho, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and chief of the General Staff of the KPA, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Pak To Chun, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Ok, first vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, and KPA Generals Kim Myong Guk, Kim Won Hong, Pak Jae Gyong and Hyon Chol Hae. 
					
					 He was greeted by KPA General Ri Pyong Chol, commander of the Air Force of the KPA, KPA Lieut. General Son Chong Nam and other general officers and commanding officers of the unit.
					
					 After receiving a salute, he recognized Hero of the DPRK Ho Ryong among commanding officers and praised him again for the bravery displayed by him in repelling a U.S. imperialist strategic reconnaissance plane's intrusion into the territorial air of the country. 
					
					 After learning about the performance of guard duty of the unit, he mounted a commanding post and watched pilots' flight exercise. 
					
					  Watching the brave exercise of the airmen who neither make an empty talk nor show any mercy, he expressed great satisfaction over the fact that all the pilots have prepared themselves as competent combat pilots through energetic flight exercise, deeply mindful that exercise means combat. He congratulated them on their successful training.
					
					 Our proud pilots are strong in idea and faith as they are filled with the grit to firmly defend the inviolable territorial air of the socialist country like human bombs, he said, adding: Always invulnerable is the sky of the country guarded by such reliable air force.
					
					 He met 14 pilots of Unit 447 of the KPA Air Force who successfully performed a difficult combat flying duty.
					
					 He invited them with loving care to have a photo taken with him.
					
					 He once again praised the unit for following the enemies' moves for aggression with vigilance and performing its guard duty in a responsible manner, always keeping itself in high combat readiness. He encouraged the pilots.
					
					 He had a photo session with the servicepersons of the unit.
					
					 Informed that the pilots who participated in the flight exercise have not yet arrived at the venue of the photo session, he waited for them to reach there.
					
					 When he saw the pilots on the photographing stand, he called them to come close to him and congratulated them on their successful flight exercise. When they sincerely wished him good health on his long journey for field guidance, he also wished them good health and success in their training.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets PM of Latvia
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets PM of Latvia

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- Choe Yong Rim, premier of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Valdis Dombrovskis upon his reappointment as prime minister of Latvia.
					
					 The message wished the prime minister success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country and well-being of the people.
					
					 Meanwhile DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to Edgars Rinkvis on his appointment as foreign minister of Latvia on the same day.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets Jordanian PM
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets Jordanian PM

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Awn Khasawneh upon his appointment as prime minister of Jordan.
					
					 The message hoped that he would always gain successes in his work for the progress and prosperity of the country.
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a congratulatory message to Nasser Judeh upon his reappointment as foreign minister of Jordan on the same day.

articles.title: DPRK Head on Measures for UNESCO Mid-term Strategy
articles.content:
DPRK  Head on Measures for UNESCO Mid-term Strategy

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- The 36th UNESCO General Conference is of importance as it reviews the second-period activities for the body's present mid-term strategy and discusses the measures for successfully concluding the final period, said the head of the DPRK delegation at its plenary meeting on Oct. 28. 
					
					 The DPRK considers that the 2012-2013 program and draft budget, to be adopted at the current meeting, have been worked out in direction of successfully attaining the goals, set forth in the mid-term strategy, including realization of quality all-people education, promotion of cultural diversity and cultural dialogue and building of comprehensive knowledge-based society through telecommunications, he said, adding: 
					
					 UNESCO will have to continue directing big efforts to the work for satisfactorily hitting the UN New Millennium Development Goals and other international development goals in the new period, too. 
					
					 It should also concentrate efforts on such main programs as quality education and lifelong education, renewable energy, promotion of heritage and cultural expression and increased capability of telecommunications to reach the objectives of the mid-term strategy, and thus raise effectiveness of their implementation.
					
					 Priority should be steadily given to programs of assistance for developing countries. Especially, it is needed to encourage the programs related to the issues of intensifying education aid and capability, transferring latest science and technology and preserving cultural heritages for those countries. 
					
					 The program and budget for new period should be implemented in direction of concentrating budget on the main goals and priority objects, if possible, while evading dispersion of the program and budget and removing complicated procedures. 
					
					 Now a dynamic great drive for building a thriving country is going on in the DPRK under the wise leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The DPRK's efforts for peaceful development will be conducive to bringing the ideal of UNESCO into reality, and this means that the DPRK is joining the international community in the efforts to reach the New Millennium Development Goals and sustained development goals of the United Nations.

articles.title: DPRK to Boost Relations with UNESCO Member Nations
articles.content:
DPRK to Boost Relations with UNESCO Member Nations

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government will further develop the friendly and cooperative relations with all UNESCO member nations and make positive contribution to the international efforts for global peace and security and common development and prosperity of mankind.
					
					 The head of the DPRK delegation stressed this, speaking at the plenary meeting of the 36th General Conference of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) on Oct. 28.
					
					 The DPRK has invariably respected the charter and ideal of the UNESCO and taken active part in the organization activities since its admission to it, the head said.
					
					 Recalling that the DPRK and the UNESCO have further strengthened their cooperation over the past two years, thus expanding cooperation fields including education, science and culture and successfully carrying out the cooperation projects, he said:
					
					 The DPRK government has concentrated all efforts on the economic construction, with the main stress put on radically improving the people's living standard, thus registering signal successes.
					
					 The economic construction in the DPRK needs stable and peaceful environment, and it is based on the development of up-to-date science and technology in the present era of the knowledge-based economy.
					
					 This construction is accompanied by the development of quality education suited to the requirement of the new century, the education whereby everybody learns, and the building of sound and civilized socialist culture.
					
					 Independence, peace and friendship are the consistent idea of the DPRK's foreign policy.

articles.title: Italian Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Italian Delegation Visits Mangyongdae

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- The Italian delegation of assemblymen from different political parties led by Mauro Del Vecchio, senator from the Democratic Party, visited Mangyongdae, birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The visitors looked round historic relics at the President's old home there, being briefed on his revolutionary history and members of the Mangyongdae family.
					
					 They had a photograph taken in commemoration of their visit to the old home.
					
					 Meanwhile, the delegation toured the Party Founding Memorial Tower, the Taedonggang Tile Factory and other places.

articles.title: Opera "Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai" Staged in Daqing
articles.content:
Opera "Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai" Staged in Daqing

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- "Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai", opera portrayed by artistes of the Phibada Opera Troupe of the DPRK, was staged before full house in Daqing, China on Oct. 30 and 31.
					
					 It evoked lively response from the audience.
					
					 The deputy secretary of the Daqing City Committee of the Communist Party of China said he was greatly impressed by the opera, praising the high level of the Korean artistes.
					
					 He expressed thanks for giving such a fascinating performance.
					
					 The general manager of the Daqing Cultural Group and concurrently party secretary said that the performance of the opera in the city holds great significance.
					
					 He hoped that the DPRK art troupes would often come to the city in the future.
					
					 The former chairman of the Daqing Municipal Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference said that he felt deep feelings of friendship between the two peoples, wishing the troupe bigger success in its performance tour of China.
					
					 The chairman of the Literature and Art Association who is also chairman of the Dance Association in Heilongjiang Province said the Korean artistes portrayed the Chinese folk tale in a perfect way by displaying unique talents.
					
					 The art inspector general of Daqing Cultural Group said every scene of the opera was fascinating, adding that the rendition of the artistes was delicate and dance movements were perfect, in particular.

articles.title: Iron Stakes Testify to Japan's Crimes
articles.content:
Iron Stakes Testify to Japan's Crimes

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- Iron stakes, believed to have been driven by the Japanese imperialists during their colonial rule over Korea, were discovered in Kaesong area, which was a birthplace and capital of Koryo Dynasty (early 10th century-late 14th century).
					
					 One iron stake was found driven in Mt. Songak, three in Mt. Chonma and two in Mt. Jine. Each stake is about one meter long and 30 millimeters across.
					
					 Traces of driven iron stakes were also found on the top of Mt. Songak and on a rock of Mt. Jine.
					
					 Some of iron stakes were found broken.
					
					 Each spot has three traces of iron stakes. All of the driven iron stakes were buried halfway by a mixture of cement and sulphur.
					
					 In the early 20th century, the Japanese imperialists rammed down iron stakes in mountains all over Korea.
					
					 After that, they spread a false rumor that with all famous Korean mountains deprived of soul, a great person would no longer appear among the Korean people.
					
					 According to data available, the Japanese imperialists drove hundreds of iron stakes in famous mountains and major sites on the basis of the theory of divination.
					
					 At the end of the 1930s, they dug out mountain ranges in Kaesong area to the effect that they severed the territory of Korea and killed the soul of the Korean nation.
					
					 The discoveries testify to the crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists to obliterate the Korean nation.

articles.title: Production of Consumer Goods Increases in DPRK
articles.content:
Production of Consumer Goods Increases in DPRK

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- Officials and workers in the light industrial field of the DPRK are bringing about improvement in production of consumer goods.
					
					 Different units of light industry overfulfilled their October economic plans.
					
					 The Knitting Industry Management Bureau, which has fulfilled its knitwear production plan every month, topped its October assignment 104%.
					
					 The Kanggye Knitting Mill carried out its yearly plan through scrupulous arrangement of production.
					
					 Songyo, Sinuiju and Sariwon knitting mills, the Pyongyang Children's Knitted Goods Factory, Aeguk Knitted Goods Factory and the Pyongyang Hosiery Factory fulfilled their October assignments on all indices.
					
					 Units under the Ministry of Foodstuff and Daily Necessities Industry, too, overfulfilled their monthly plans through intensified cooperation among processes and shifts and the collective innovation drive.
					
					 Among them are the Pyongyang Flour Processing Factory, Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory, Pyongyang Children's Foodstuff Factory, Kyongryon Aeguk Soda-Pop Mill and the Taedonggang Food Factory.
					
					 Those which overfullfilled the production on all indices include the Pyongyang Plastic Pencil Factory, Pyongyang Daily Necessities Factory, Sinuiju Enameled Ironware Factory, Kanggye Pencil Factory, Jonchon Match Factory and Rangnang and Hamhung disabled soldiers' essential plastic goods factories.
					
					 The Textile Machine Industry Management Bureau fulfilled the monthly plan, increasing the production by 13% as compared with the same period of last year.
					
					 The Pyongyang Textile Machine Factory, Pyongyang Auxiliary Parts Factory, Ongjin Knitting Needle Factory and the Sinuiju Spinning Machine Factory tapped all available latent reserves and potentials to raise the production results, thus making contributions to increasing the output of consumer goods.

articles.title: Guidelines for Juche-oriented Cinematic Art
articles.content:
Guidelines for Juche-oriented Cinematic Art

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung published a famous work "On Some Problems Arising in the Creation of Revolutionary Films" in November Juche 57 (1968.)
					
					 In the work, he said what is important for cinematic art in discharging its mission and duty is to create characters encouraging the popular masses in their struggle for independence. 
					
					 He called for producing many films truthfully portraying people of all walks of life becoming revolutionaries.  
					
					 The work clarifies the nature of Juche-based cinematic art and ways for its development. 
					
					 Since the work was published, a signal turn has been made in developing film art in the country. 
					
					 Masterpieces, including "The Sea of Blood" and "The Fate of a Self-defense Corps Man", were adapted to films under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 Many feature films encourage people to accelerate socialist construction, carrying forward the tradition of struggle provided by the anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters.  
					
					 Typical of them are "Five Guerrilla Brothers", "The Flourishing Village", "A Worker's Family" and "Rolling Workers."

articles.title: Ryangchon Temple
articles.content:
Ryangchon Temple

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- There is Ryangchon Temple in Rakchon-ri, Kowon County, South Hamgyong Province.
					
					 The temple, built in 753 and rebuilt several times, preserves paintings and other valuable historic relics in their origin.
					
					 The main building, Muryangsu Hall and Manse Pavilion still remain in the temple.
					
					 The colorfully painted main building has a crane-shaped roof with belly-shaped eaves. Its walls are decorated with paintings portraying customs of the Korean nation at that time.
					
					 Manse Pavilion, rebuilt in 1729, was also painted with dragon, tiger, flower and other patterns.
					
					 The temple is one of the national heritages showing a high level of the Korean people's architecture and painting.

articles.title: Sophism of Japanese Chief Executive under Fire
articles.content:
Sophism of Japanese Chief Executive under Fire

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- The Japanese chief executive at recent parade of the Japan Air "Self-Defence Force" called for coping with the "threat" from other countries. He said the military exercises of the DPRK and military expansion of China "challenge" Japan's security.
					
					 This is sheer sophism aimed to justify the moves to turn the country into a military power and reinvade Korea under the pretext of the "military threat" from outside.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined commentary.
					
					 The commentary cites facts, blaming the tensions running high in Northeast Asia mainly on Japan's undisguised moves to emerge a military power.
					
					 It is an unchanged ambition of the Japanese reactionaries to become the "leader" in Asia and realize their old dream of the "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere". The Japanese militarists consider that they suffered defeat in the Pacific War due to the lack of military strength. It is, therefore, by no means accidental that they make earnest efforts to arm the Japan "Self-Defence Forces" (SDF) with the ultra-modern military equipment and increase their military capability, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 It is an important aim sought by the Japanese reactionary rulers to turn the SDF into offensive type from defensive type and let them possess the military capability suited to it.
					
					 The recent moves of the Japanese reactionaries to realize the ambition of the "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere" have gone beyond the danger level under the signboard of "defence".
					
					 The dark clouds of arms race and aggression war are hanging low in the region due to the reckless moves of the Japanese reactionaries to hold military hegemony in Asia.
					
					 Japan, a defeated nation, is persisting in the moves to become a military power, oblivious of the bitter lesson in the past. This will hasten its destruction.
					
					 Should the Japanese militarists opt for reinvasion at last under the pretext of coping with the non-existent "military threat", they will not be able to escape stern punishment.

articles.title: Victory of Socialism Is Inevitable
articles.content:
Victory of Socialism Is Inevitable

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Wednesday carries a by-lined article dedicated to the 17th anniversary of the publication of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Socialism Is a Science".
					
					 The work, published on November 1, Juche 83(1994), comprehensively clarifies the absolute advantages of socialism over capitalism, the limitation of the preceding socialist theory, the originality of the Juche-oriented socialist theory and the inevitability of victory in Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses.
					
					 If there are people, there is the idea of socialism and if socialism remains, independence and justice exist, the article says, stressing socialism is sure to emerge victorious as it is the independent desire of the people and their will.
					
					 Korean socialism represents a big family in which all its members are united in single mind. This family wins one victory after another thanks to the driving force of the Songun revolution which makes steady progress under the leadership of the party and the leader. Under this socialism the revolutionary principle of collectivism has been firmly adhered to in all fabrics of social life and the people's worthwhile life and happiness have been brought into full bloom thanks to the leader's politics of loving care and trust, it notes.
					
					 The driving force of the Korean revolution has grown stronger in every way since the historic Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea, it says, adding:
					
					 The army and the people have dynamically advanced toward a new victory of the Juche revolution while sharing the same thought and will with the headquarters of the revolution and keeping pace with them.
					
					 In the ongoing advance for a great surge the Korean people have boosted the comradely cooperation and unity at every unit and post under the slogan "One for All and All for One!", thus fully displaying popular heroism in socialist construction.
					
					 Absolute and steadfast are the support and confidence of the Korean people in the mother party which has created an epic of great loving care and devotion to the people under the slogan "We Serve the People!" despite the grave trials of history.

articles.title: No Future for Traitors Seeking Confrontation
articles.content:
No Future for Traitors Seeking Confrontation

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- Traitors are short-lived as they seek to prolong their remaining days by stoking confrontation with compatriots, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a bylined article.
					
					 The inter-Korean relations have stood in acute confrontation with each other for more than 3 years which is blamed on the south Korean authorities' vicious policy of confrontation with the DPRK, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 All the dialogues and cooperation have been suspended and confrontation has escalated between the north and the south since the conservative authorities took office in south Korea in 2008. This regime has approached from negative stand all the successes made in the June 15 era of reunification. 
					
					 The north-south relations can never improve as long as the south Korean authorities regard the DPRK as a target of confrontation and are set to do harm to it, a partner with whom they should get reconciled and united.
					
					 It is prerequisite for the south Korean authorities to make a switchover in their confrontation policy to ensure peace and security in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 To waste time and wealth away for confrontation and preparations for a war is a crime and an act of treachery.
					
					 If a war breaks out in the Korean Peninsula, the victims will be the Koreans in the north and the south. 
					
					 If the north and the south escalate confrontation, the nation will suffer and foreign forces will benefit from it. 
					
					 The peace and security can settle on the peninsula only when the south Korean authorities make a switchover in their confrontation policy and press for mending the fence with the DPRK. 
					
					 The switchover in the confrontation policy is also urgently required for implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration. 
					
					 Now is the time for all the Koreans to pool their efforts and for the north and the south to unite for reunification, a long-cherished desire of the Korean nation.
					
					 To persist in confrontation with the DPRK and deny the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration and the Oct. 4 declaration at this time is an intolerable anti-reunification act. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should immediately roll back the anachronistic policy denounced by all the Koreans.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on Crisis of Capitalism
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on Crisis of Capitalism

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- Capitalism is in the grip of the worst crisis, rejected everywhere in the world for its structural contradiction and reactionary nature.
					
					 It has found itself in more serious crisis since it sought "globalization" while clamoring about the "end" of socialism.
					
					 Many developing countries including those in Africa got mired in socio-political chaos and are in the miserable plight with tens of millions of people losing their lives or seeking refuges.
					
					 Financial liberalization pursuant to "globalization" stoked speculation and deepened financial crisis worldwide.
					
					 Mexico directly incurred loss of 42 billion U.S. dollars due to the financial crisis in 1995. The financial crisis that hit Asia in 1997 brought down the GDP at least 50 percent in the countries concerned. But the present financial crisis worldwide has caused a loss of trillion U.S. dollars on earth.
					
					 The U.S. and other capitalist countries of the West which pushed ahead with "globalization" are now in trouble being caught in its whirlpool.
					
					 Capitalism which revived with U.S. imperialism as a core after the Second World War was elated in high spirit since the end of the Cold War. But now it is being shaken to its roots, festering from its center.
					
					 The U.S. finds itself in the bottomless abyss of ruin due to the "war on terrorism" which it called the Third World War, just like the past fascist powers who met self-destruction in the disastrous world wars against humanity.
					
					 The financial crisis which started in the U.S. is developing into that of the capitalist world as a whole, sharpening class contradiction. The revolutionary advance of the oppressed toiling masses such as "Occupy Wall Street" demo is being intensified on a worldwide scale.
					
					 Capitalism in which the minority dominates the majority, exploiting and plundering them is on the verge of judgment by history.
					
					 Financial supremacy, the last mainstay of U.S. imperialism, is on the point of collapse.
					
					 Various countries are showing the trend of converting their foreign currencies into gold out of concern that U.S. debt snowballing beyond 14 trillion dollars may lead to the possible dollar depreciation.
					
					 The era is coming to an end when the minority of capitalist powers have exploited and plundered the majority of countries and peoples at will.
					
					 BRICS, grouping Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa, are bravely challenging the outdated West-led international economic order with South-South cooperation.
					
					 They are using national currencies when settling mutual trade, thereby dealing decisive counteraction to the U.S. dollar supremacy and increasing their political and economic position and the right to speak.
					
					 Developing countries including those in Asia and Latin America are suffering less from the current financial crisis than in the 1990s thanks to the multilateral cooperation in reliance upon ASEAN, ALBA and other regional organizations.
					
					 Contradiction and antagonism are getting serious among capitalist countries.
					
					 "Warfare" between U.S. dollar and euro is surfacing over the U.S. design to get benefit by deliberately reducing the dollar price.
					
					 Nexus among capitalist countries has been marred, bringing contradiction to the fore as they have become competitive in their scrambles for strategic resources and markets.

articles.title: Military Truck Overturned in S. Korea
articles.content:
Military Truck Overturned in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- A truck belonging to a unit of the 6th Army Corps of the south Korean puppet forces was overturned in Jongok Township, Ryonchon County, Kyonggi Province, according to south Korean MBC.
					
					 The truck was participating in the Hoguk military exercises, a big war game for invasion of the DPRK.
					
					 Several soldiers were killed or wounded in the accident.

articles.title: S. Korean Newspaper Blasts Authorities for Ignoring Public Voice
articles.content:
S. Korean Newspaper Blasts Authorities for Ignoring Public Voice

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- Hangyore, a newspaper of south Korea, on October 31 carried an article titled "The president never pretends to give an ear to the public voice".
					
					 The "government" and the ruling party still disregard the people's voice, far from drawing a bitter lesson from the October 26 Seoul mayoral election and reflecting on their misconducts, the article said, adding:
					
					 In the recent election many Seoul citizens punished the wrong unpopular policy of the present "government" and the former mayor.
					
					 The chief executive, however, named O Chong Su as chief of security guard in Chongwadae just after the election. O was dismissed from the chief of the Police Agency for the crackdown on candlelight rally in 2008.
					
					 On the election results, the representative of the "Grand National Party" claimed that "there was neither victory nor defeat", the article noted, saying the ruling party has no elementary common sense in politics that any statesman would pretend to complain of pain when he is hit by the people.
					
					 The article censured the ruling GNP for downplaying the people's voice.

articles.title: Mexican Politician on Kim Jong Il's Answers
articles.content:
Mexican Politician on Kim Jong Il's Answers 

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's answers to questions put by ITAR-TASS of Russia are creating a big stir in the world political and public circles, said Cuautemoc Amezcua Dromundo, chairman of the C.C., Socialist Popular Party of Mexico, in a statement on Oct. 23.
					
					 Kim Jong Il in his answers made clear the prospect of development of the DPRK-Russia relations, the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula, the resumption of the six-party talks and the DPRK's relations with the U.S. and Japan, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 As he clarified, any hostility or aggression and disintegration moves by the U.S. can never work on the Korean people, but will always end in failure.
					
					 The U.S. should drop its hostile policy towards the DPRK. Japan which committed never-to-be-condoned crimes against the Korean people in the past, too, should settle its inglorious past and quit the hostile policy towards the DPRK.

articles.title: Russian Organization on Kim Jong Il's Answers
articles.content:
Russian Organization on Kim Jong Il's Answers

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- The Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK made public a statement on Oct. 26 over the answers General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave to questions put by ITAR-TASS of Russia.
					
					 The Russian people highly appreciate the answers of Kim Jong Il, the statement said, adding that they are a guideline for strengthening the Russia-DPRK friendship.
					
					 It went on to say:
					
					 As Kim Jong Il said, it entirely conforms to the interests of the two peoples to steadily develop in depth the history and tradition of the bilateral friendship and it is of weighty significance in safeguarding peace and stability in Northeast Asia.
					
					 Clarified in the answers are the comprehensive analysis into the situation of the Korean Peninsula and the cause of the aggravated situation in the region.
					
					 We have always supported the Korean people's efforts for building a prosperous and powerful country to which President Kim Il Sung, the great leader of the Korean people, devoted all his life.
					
					 Like other countries, Russia is actively conducing the work to significantly commemorate the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 We are sure that April next year will be an occasion of displaying the great victory of the DPRK's domestic and foreign policies and the international solidarity with the Korean people.

articles.title: World Population Reaches 7 Billion
articles.content:
World Population Reaches 7 Billion

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- The world population reached 7 billion as of Oct. 31.
					
					 The 7 billionth baby was born in India on the day, according to the United Nations Population Fund.

articles.title: China Rebuts US Accusation of Hacker Attacks
articles.content:
China Rebuts US Accusation of Hacker Attacks

					 Beijing, November 1 (KCNA) -- China on Monday rejected a U.S. accusation that it had hacked into an American satellite system, calling the claim "factitious."
					
					 Foreign Ministry spokesman Hong Lei made the comments when questioned about a recent report on the suspicions by the United States-China Economic and Security Review Commission.
					
					 "This commission always observes China through tainted glasses. The report is totally factitious, made with ulterior motives, and does not warrant refuting," Hong said.
					
					 China has been a victim of hacker attacks as well, Hong said, adding the country opposes any kind of cyber crime.

articles.title: China Launches Spacecraft Shenzhou-8
articles.content:
China Launches Spacecraft Shenzhou-8

					 Beijing, November 1 (KCNA) -- China's unmanned spacecraft Shenzhou-8 blasted off from the Jiuquan Satellite Launch Center in northwest desert area on Tuesday. 
					
					 It successfully separated from its carrier rocket, a modified Long March-2F, and entered a low Earth orbit. 
					
					 The spacecraft is expected to dock with Tiangong-1 space lab module that was sent into space on Sept. 29.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits China
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits China

					 Beijing, November 1 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 5.4 on the Richter scale jolted the border area of the Qingchuan County in the city of Guangyuan in Sichuan Province and Wenxian County in the city of Longnan in Gansu Province Tuesday.
					
					 The epicenter was northeastern area in Sichuan Province.

articles.title: US Drone Strike Kills 6 in NW Pakistan
articles.content:
US Drone Strike Kills 6 in NW Pakistan

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces in Afghanistan are ceaselessly killing Pakistanis under the pretext of "anti-terrorism".
					
					 A U.S. pilotless aircraft fired six missiles on a house in Pakistan's North Waziristan tribal region on Sunday, killing at least 6 people, local media reported.

articles.title: Americans' Support for Afghan War at Record Low: Poll
articles.content:
Americans' Support for Afghan War at Record Low: Poll

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- Americans' support for the decade-long Afghanistan war has dropped to an all time low, a new national poll showed Friday.
					
					 63 percent of those surveyed said they are opposed to the war, according to the CNN/ORC International Poll.

articles.title: Japan's Unemployment Rate in Sept.
articles.content:
Japan's Unemployment Rate in Sept.

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- Unemployed people in September stood at 2.75 million in Japan, the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications said in a report on Friday.

articles.title: Japan's Businesses in Stagnation
articles.content:
Japan's Businesses in Stagnation

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- Japan's vehicle production in the April-September period fell 18.5 percent from a year earlier, according to the Japan Automobile Manufacturers Association said Friday.
					
					 All Nippon Airways Co. reported Friday a group operating profit fell 11.8 percent from a year earlier in the April-September period.

articles.title: Japan SDFs Stage Military Maneuvers
articles.content:
Japan SDFs Stage Military Maneuvers

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- The Japan "Self-Defense Forces" recently launched various military exercises, stirring up the atmosphere of war.
					
					 The ground SDF has staged the drill of redeploying its unit in Hokkaido to Kyushu from Oct. 29.
					
					 The exercise which will last till Nov. 9 is expected to involve a shooting drill.
					
					 Meanwhile, the maritime SDF is waging a joint rehearsal with the U.S. aircraft carrier and other war means involved in waters off Okinawa.

articles.title: UN Report on Iran Human Rights Situation Biased
articles.content:
UN Report on Iran Human Rights Situation Biased

					 Tehran, November 1 (KCNA) -- Iran's Parliament member Farhad Tajari said the recent report of the United Nations Human Rights Committee on Iran's human rights situation is biased. 
					
					 Talking to IRNA on Saturday, Tajari described as "political" and "unrealistic" the report by Ahmed Shaheed who serves as the UN special rapporteur on human rights in Iran and stressed that international bodies should not be manipulated as tools in service of political interests.

articles.title: Pakistan Rejects American Allegations
articles.content:
Pakistan Rejects American Allegations

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- Pakistan has rejected U.S. allegations that Pakistan army allows militants to fire on American troops across the border in Afghanistan. 
					
					 Military spokesman Major General Athar Abbas has completely rejected the American accusations terming them wrong and baseless.

articles.title: Flood Damage Increases in Thailand
articles.content:
Flood Damage Increases in Thailan

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- The flood damage is on the increase in Thailand.
					
					 On Oct. 30 several dams in the capital city's riverside gave way, inundating the central part of the city.
					
					The water level in some streets rose to 2 meters.
					
					 The number of the dead increased to 381.
					
					 This damage is reportedly the worst in 50 years in the country.
					
					 The government is taking several measures to recover from the damage.

articles.title: Occupy Melbourne Protesters March Peacefully in Australia
articles.content:
Occupy Melbourne Protesters March Peacefully in Australia

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- More than 1,000 Occupy Melbourne protesters on Saturday marched on the Treasury Gardens in Melbourne of Australia.
					
					 The protesters marched peacefully with a colorful array of signs of banners writing "we are the 99 percent", in a move to express their views against corporate greed.

articles.title: Ecuadorian FM Defends Cuba's Right to Live Free from Blockade
articles.content:
Ecuadorian FM Defends Cuba's Right to Live Free from Blockade

					 Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- The Ecuadorian foreign minister affirmed his country's commitment to Cuba's fight against the U.S.-imposed blockade. 
					
					 Responding to a question by Prensa Latina on the recent condemnation by 186 countries of the U.S. economic, trade and financial blockade on Cuba, the Ecuadorian diplomatic head stated that the UN has spoken out for 20 consecutive years against the blockade. "And it is not the OAS, but the UN, which for 20 times in a row has expressed its disagreement and dissatisfaction, and demanded an end to the blockade. A giant country, the United States, is clearly trying to change by force the government of another country," he noted.

articles.title: Iran Raps US Absurd Attempt
articles.content:
Iran Raps US Absurd Attempt

					 Tehran, November 1 (KCNA) -- Ali Larijani, speaker of the Iranian Majlis, at a press conference on Oct. 27 condemned the U.S. for its absurd attempt to set up an imaginary U.S. embassy in Iran.
					
					 This signifies the U.S. administration's ignorance of politics, he said, holding that the U.S. is gravely mistaken if it thinks it can do something in Iran through the imaginary embassy.
					
					 This will only prompt the Iranians to get in closer unity, he stressed.

articles.title: Delegado coreano interviene en conferencia general de UNESCO
articles.content:
Delegado coreano interviene en conferencia general de UNESCO

					Pyongyang, 2 de noviembre (ACNC) -- La 36a conferencia general de UNESCO deviene una reunion importante que balancea el segundo periodo de actividades para el cumplimiento de la actual estrategia de mediano plazo y discute los remedios para concluir exitosamente el periodo final.
					
					Destaco asi el jefe de la delegacion coreana en su discurso pronunciado el 28 de octubre en la sesion plenaria de la 36a conferencia general de UNESCO, y continuo:
					
					Consideramos que el proyecto del plan y presupuesto para 2012-2013, que se adoptara en la presente reunion, fue elaborado para alcanzar con exito las metas presentadas en la estrategia de mediano plazo, incluyendo la cualitativa educacion de todo el pueblo, la diversidad cultural y el fomento de dialogo intercultural, la construccion de una global sociedad intelectual mediante telecomunicaciones.
					
					Tambien en el nuevo periodo, la UNESCO debera seguir esforzandose mucho por cumplir satisfactoriamente las metas de desarrollo de nuevo milenio de la ONU y las otras internacionales de desarrollo.
					
					Para cumplir los objetivos presentados en la estrategia referida, la UNESCO debera dar enfoque a los planes principales, como la cualitativa educacion y la educacion de toda la vida, el tema de energia renovable, el fomento de patrimonios y expresiones culturales, y la intensificacion de la capacidad de telecomunicaciones, y elevar la eficiencia de su ejecucion.
					
					Debera seguir dando prioridad a los planes de cooperacion para los paises en vias de desarrollo, particularmente, es necesario fomentar para ellos los planes de la ayuda educacional e intensificacion de su capacidad, la transferencia de ciencias y tecnologias sofisticadas y la preservacion de patrimonios culturales. 
					
					Los planes y presupuestos para el nuevo periodo deberan ser puestos en practica en direccion a evitar la disgregacion de planes y presupuestos, eliminar los tramites y procesos complicados y concentrar los presupuestos en las metas principales y los objetos priorizados.
					
					Hoy en dia, se despliega en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea una gran marcha para cumplir la causa de construccion de un Estado prospero bajo la sabia guia del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Contribuyendo al cumplimiento del ideal de la UNESCO, los esfuerzos de la RPDC por el desarrollo pacifico seran sumados a los de la sociedad internacional por alcanzar las metas de desarrollo de nuevo milenio y otras de desarrollo sostenido de la ONU.

articles.title: Corea fortalecera amistad y cooperacion con UNESCO
articles.content:
Corea fortalecera amistad y cooperacion con UNESCO

					Pyongyang, 2 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea fortalecera las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con los paises miembros de la Organizacion de las Naciones Unidas para la Educacion, la Ciencia y la Cultura (UNESCO) y hara activo aporte a los esfuerzos internacionales por preservar la paz y la seguridad del mundo y lograr el desarrollo y la prosperidad comunes de la humanidad.
					
					 Asi senalo el dia 28 de octubre el jefe de delegacion coreana al hacer uso de la palabra en el pleno del 36o periodo de sesiones de la asamblea general de la UNESCO.
					
					  Dijo que despues del ingreso en la UNESCO, la RPDC respeto invariablemente la Carta y el ideal de la organizacion y participa activamente en sus actividades.
					
					 Gracias al fortalecimiento de la colaboracion entre la RPDC y la UNESCO, se amplio durante los 2 ultimos anos la esfera de cooperacion como la educacion, la ciencia y la cultura y se ejecutaron con exito los planes en cuanto a los objetos de cooperacion, agrego.
					
					  Prosiguio que el gobierno de la RPDC concentra todas las fuerzas en la construccion economica dando prioridad a mejorar las condiciones de la vida del pueblo, de manera que logra los exitos sin  precedentes.
					
					  Nuestra construccion economica demanda el ambiente estable y pacifico y se realiza a base del desarrollo de la ciencia y tecnica de punta conveniente a la epoca de la economia intelectual, destaco.
					
					  Tambien implica la educacion de alta calidad conforme a la demanda de nuevo siglo, el desarrollo de la educacion en que estudia todo el pueblo y la construccion de cultura socialista sana y civil, apunto
					
					  Subrayo que la independencia, la paz y la amistad son el invariable ideal de la RPDC en la politica exterior.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia sofisma del gobernador japones
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia sofisma del gobernador japones

					Pyongyang, 2 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Hace poco, el gobernador japones en el desfile de las "Fuerzas Aereas de Autodefensa" dijo que los ejercicios militares de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la ampliacion de las fuerzas militares de China son los "desafios" a la seguridad de Japon y se refirio a "hacer frente" a la "amenaza" de alguien.
					
					Esto es sofisma astuto para justificar la realizacion de la potencia militar y la reagresion de Japon so pretexto de la "amenaza militar" de otro pais
					
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido este miercoles y continua:
					
					Hoy dia, la agravacion de situacion de la region del Nordeste Asiatico esta relacionada con la abierta maquinacion de Japon tendente a convertirse en la potencia militar.
					
					Realizar el sueno antiguo con la "Esfera de Coprosperidad de la Gran Asia Oriental" siendo el caudillo de "Asia" es la ambicion invariable de los reaccionarios japoneses.
					
					Los militaristas japoneses consideran que ellos mismos fueron derrotados en la Guerra Pacifica por la falta de las fuerzas militares e intentan armar a las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" con los equipos militares de punta y aumentar su capacidad de combate.
					
					Persiguen convertir las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" de tipo defensivo en el ofensivo y poseer la capacidad militar correspondiente.
					
					Ahora, las maquinaciones de los reaccionarios japoneses encaminadas a realizar la ambicion de la "Esfera de Coprosperidad de la Gran Asia Oriental" sobrepasan el limite peligroso bajo el rotulo de la "defensa".
					
					Debido a sus imprudentes maniobras encaminadas a tomar la heguemonia militar en Asia, se ciernen  en esta region los nubarrones negros de carrera armamentista y la guerra agresiva.
					
					Japon, pais derrotado en la Segunda Guerra Mundial, recurre hasta hoy a las maquinaciones tendentes a convertirse en la potencia militar olvidando la leccion del pasado, lo cual  adelantara solo su autodestruccion. 
					
					Si los militaristas japoneses toman por fin el camino de reagresion bajo el rotulo de hacer frente a la supuesta "amenaza militar", no podran evitar el castigo severo.

articles.title: ACNC comenta la crisis de capitalismo
articles.content:
ACNC comenta la crisis de capitalismo

					Pyongyang, 2 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El capitalismo esta condenado y se encuentra en la peor crisis por doquier del mundo por sus contradicciones estructurales y el caracter reaccionario.
					
					El capitalismo inicio a hundirse en la severa crisis desde cuando se haya desesperado por globalizar el capitalismo hablando tanto del fin del socialismo.
					
					Los paises africanos y otros paises en vias de desarrollo se hundieron en el caos socio-politico y decenas de millones de personas perdieron sus vidas vagaron sin hogares.
					
					El liberalismo financiero por la "globalizacion" fomento en el ambito mundial la especulacion y profundizo la crisis financiera.
					
					En 1995, Mexico sufrio la perdida de 42 mil millones de US$ por la crisis financiera y en 1997, por la crisis financiera de Asia el valor total de produccion nacional de los paises interesados se disminuyo por lo menos 50 %.
					
					La actual crisis financiera y economica del mundo provoco en la escala del planeta billones de US$.
					
					Estados Unidos y otros paises capitalitas occidentales, que habian promovido la "globalizacion", estan arrastrados por el torbellino de este fenomeno.
					
					Se sacude desde su raiz el capitalismo renacido cuyo centro es el imperialismo norteamericano despues de la Segunda Guerra Mundial y engreido despues del fin de la guerra fria.
					
					Como las potencias fascistas autodestruidas en la  catastrofica guerra mundial contra la humanidad, EE.UU. cayo en un atolladero sin salida por su "guerra antiterrorista" denominada por si mismo como la tercera guerra mundial.
					
					Se extiende la crisis financiera y economica del imperio por todo el mundo capitalista y se agudiza la contradiccion clasista. Se intensifica el avance revolucionario de las masas populares explotadas como la manifestacion "Ocupa Wall Street".
					
					La heguemonia financiera, ultimo punto de apoyo del imperialismo norteamericano esta tambien en vispera de bancarrota.
					
					La tendencia actual es que varios paises compran oro como reserva de divisas en vez de dolar preocupandose por la crisis de deuda de EE.UU. que se aumenta incesantemente sobrepasando el limite de 14 billones US$, lo que podria  provocar la baja de valor de dolar norteamericano,.
					
					Va a terminar la epoca en que la minoria de las potencias capitalistas explotaba y saqueaba a su antojo a la mayoria de los paises y los pueblos del mundo.
					
					BRICs (Brasil, Rusia, India, China y Sudafrica) se enfrenta categoricamente con la cooperacion Sur-Sur al viejo orden economico internacional cuya supremacia pertenece al Occidente.
					
					Asesta contraataque decisivo a la hegemonia de dolar estadounidense realizando la liquidacion comercial mutua con monedas nacionales y eleva su posicion y derecho a la palabra en lo politico y  economico.
					
					Al fortalecer la cooperacion mutua ateniendose a la Asociacion de Naciones del Sudeste Asiatico (ASEAN), la Alianza Bolivariana para los Pueblos de Nuestra America (ALBA) y otras organizaciones regionales, los paises asiaticos, latinoamericanos y otros en vias de desarrollo reciben poca influencia negativa de la crisis financiera en comparacion con la decada de 1990.
					
					Recrudece la contradiccion interior y el antagonismo entre los paises capitalistas.
					
					En relacion con que EE.UU. intenta sacar provecho bajando artificialmente el precio de dolar se exterioriza la "guerra" entre el dolar estadounidense y euro.
					
					Desde cuando las potencias capitalistas entran a porfia en la guerra para conquistar los recursos estrategicos y los mercados se agrietane las relaciones de contubernio entre ellos y se exaltan mas sus contradicciones.
